text: Montgomery County is a county in the U.S. state of Tennessee. As of the 2020 census, the population was 220,069. The county seat is Clarksville. The county was named for John Montgomery, a soldier in the American Revolutionary War and an early settler who founded the city of Clarksville.Eleanor Williams, "Montgomery County," Tennessee Encyclopedia of History and Culture. Retrieved: March 11, 2013. Montgomery County was founded in 1836. == References == Category:1796 establishments in the United States Category:18th-century establishments in Tennessee Category:Tennessee counties
title: Montgomery County, Tennessee
